results.title: Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geography of the Americas”.
This film discusses the cities, industries, agriculture and natural resources of each of the major geographical divisions of Canada. While the film looks at the western region, the central prairies, the Great Lakes region, the Maritime Provinces and the Yukon, it also points out similarities between Canada and the United States.

results.title: Can you spare a moment?: the counselling interview (NP)
results.brief_description: This program featuring John Cleese vividly illustrates the various well-worn techniques managers use when handling a staff member with a problem. It shows the four vital stages to an effective counselling interview - Setting up the interview; Helping them think it through; Encouraging people to talk; and Letting them find a solution. Cast also includes Prunella Scales, David Robb, Art Malik, Joanne Whalley.

results.title: Can we be rich?
results.creator_credit: Cecil Musk and Film Producers Guild
results.brief_description: This film is a discussion by Geoffrey Crowther, editor of “The Economist”, on how post-war British people can raise their standard of living. He states that as a nation we can only consume as much as we can produce, and the basic problem is, therefore, that of increasing production. Using the diagram of a cake to represent the national income, he shows how it is divided, how it might be divided, and how he thinks it could be increased in size. In the course of the discussion, he deals with the relationship of imports to exports; the need for thorough mechanization of industry, including the use of electricity so as to increase production per man hour; full employment, and the necessity of minimum restrictions on the side of both capital and labour.

results.title: Can a parent be human?
results.brief_description: An open-ended film from the Searching Years series which provides role-playing situations concerning communication between parents and children. Compares ways in which parents frighten children with ways in which they make successful contact.

results.title: Camouflage in nature by pattern matching
results.brief_description: Explains how many animals bear protective colour patterns which blend with their variegated surroundings, thus providing a measure of protection. The film illustrates how those animals most needing protection, because of age, sex, or lack of ability to defend themselves, generally have subdued colouring. In contrast other animals, of a more offensive nature, have bold markings and dazzling effects.

results.title: Camera natura
results.creator_credit: Ross Gibson, John Cruthers, Australian Film Commission and Camera Natura
results.brief_description: A film about the Australian landscape as portrayed in the myths, maps, painting, writing, photography and cinema of white Australians. The video traces the developing image of the continent as it has been represented over 200 years, from the anguish of the convicted painter Thomas Watling, to the technologies of cinema and aerial photography. Written by Ross Gibson, cinematography by Ray Argall, animation by Lee Whitmore. Voices supplied by Stephen Bisley, Susan Dermody, Vivienne Garrett. Contains some black and white sequences.
